item.title: Building waste and ladders blocking footpath for a week, 25th February
item.description:
28 Brand Street is having renovation work and using the public footpath as a skip to store their waste. We have a number of disabled and elderly people who use the footpaths and now they're unable. The ladders have been left up unsecured overnight for the past week. It's really unacceptable. They need to organise a skip.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brand Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large hole. getting bigger. filled twice before with tarmac. DO IT PROPERLY!, 25th February
item.description:
Why waste taxpayers money with shoddy workmanship. Fix the problem properly... Petts Wood Road from Poverest Roundabout down to Tudor way is full of potholes. Dont just fix one and ignore the others. . DO THEM ALL!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tudor Way, Poverest, Greater London

item.title: New North Road - Potholes, 25th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 189-190, New North Road, Islington, Greater London

item.title: Tarcmac and concrete around drain between 196- 194 Bedonwell Road, 25th February
item.description:
The concrete and tarmac has sunk down surrounding the gully drain. As cars drive over it it making local residents windows vibrate. This was filled with tarmac about a week ago but it has already started to sink again. Please can this be looked into with a matter of urgency. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bedonwell Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disgusting toilets, 25th February
item.description:
The public toilets near to the bowling green are disgusting and not fit for use. At least 9 out of 13 toilets are filthy; flooded, no toilet roll, no door locks etc. This is a continuing problem and spoils my enjoyment of the park. On top of this one set of toilets near to the car park have been locked for a long time

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Park, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
